summary: Internal FBI email chain from August 2019 discussing travel arrangements for the Epstein case investigation in St. Thomas. The primary email declines the need for a forfeiture specialist to accompany the team to the search, citing that the search warrant scope does not include inventorying valuables and SDNY does not plan to forfeit valuables as criminal proceeds at that time.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.context: Author of the primary email, coordinating with SDNY and case agents, and making the decision that a forfeiture person is not needed for the search in St. Thomas.

persons.name: Special Agent — Asset Forfeiture Coordinator FBI — New York Forfeiture Asset Seizure Team
persons.context: Author of the initial email, requesting that an SFI (likely a forfeiture specialist) travel with the squad to St. Thomas to support forfeiture actions, noting full approval has been received.

connections.person2: Special Agent — Asset Forfeiture Coordinator FBI — New York Forfeiture Asset Seizure Team
connections.description: Communicating about operational logistics for the Epstein case, specifically regarding the inclusion of a forfeiture specialist on the travel team to St. Thomas.

events.title: Planned FBI travel to St. Thomas for Epstein case search
events.description: The FBI squad plans to travel to St. Thomas via the Bureau's Q400 plane to execute a search warrant as part of the Epstein investigation.
personsInvolved: Special Agent — Asset Forfeiture Coordinator FBI — New York Forfeiture Asset Seizure Team

events.title: Coordination email regarding forfeiture specialist travel
events.description: An asset forfeiture coordinator emails to request that an SFI (forfeiture specialist) travel with the FBI squad to St. Thomas, noting full approval.
personsInvolved: Special Agent — Asset Forfeiture Coordinator FBI — New York Forfeiture Asset Seizure Team

events.title: Decision not to include forfeiture specialist in search
events.description: The SSA FBI New York responds, after consulting with ASAC, SDNY, and case agents, that a forfeiture person is not necessary for the search as the warrant scope doesn't cover valuables inventory and SDNY isn't seeking forfeiture of valuables at that time.

keyFacts: The FBI was planning to execute a search warrant in St. Thomas related to the Epstein case in August 2019.
SDNY (Southern District of New York) advised that they were not seeking forfeiture of valuables from Epstein's properties at that time, as they did not qualify as proceeds from criminal behavior.
The search warrant's scope did not include conducting an inventory of all valuables at the search location.
Internal FBI coordination shows consideration of involving asset forfeiture specialists, but it was deemed unnecessary for this specific operation.
